key_insight: GateFusion combines strong pretrained audio and visual encoders with a Hierarchical Gated Fusion Decoder (HiGat) to enable fine-grained, multi-level cross-modal interactions that improve frame-level active speaker detection compared to conventional late fusion.
problem_solved: Addresses the inability of late-fusion methods to capture detailed cross-modal cues (when and which modality is most informative) in unconstrained video, causing errors in identifying who is speaking at each frame.
method: Use strong pretrained unimodal encoders for visual (face/scene) and audio streams to extract robust features.
Introduce a Hierarchical Gated Fusion Decoder (HiGat) that performs multi-level gating and cross-modal interaction to selectively combine audio and visual information.
Produce temporally-aware, frame-level speaker predictions by integrating gated fusion outputs with downstream temporal modeling.
impact: Provides a practical fusion architecture that boosts robustness of active speaker detection in noisy, real-world videos while leveraging pretrained encodersâ€”easy to adapt for related audio-visual tasks and deployment.
visual_elements: Architecture diagram: separate pretrained audio and visual encoders feeding into the Hierarchical Gated Fusion Decoder with annotated gating units.
Timeline visualization: frame-by-frame predictions with audio waveform and face crops showing where modality gating changes.
Gating heatmap: per-frame gating strengths highlighting when audio vs. visual signals dominate.
Qualitative examples: side-by-side video frames with ground-truth vs. predicted active speaker labels to show failure cases of late fusion vs. GateFusion.
paper_title: GateFusion: Hierarchical Gated Cross-Modal Fusion for Active Speaker Detection
paper_authors: Yu Wang, Juhyung Ha, Frangil M. Ramirez, Yuchen Wang, David J. Crandall
